title: Who to Follow Online
content:
- Nicholas Diakopoulos. Professor at Northwestern University and Director of the Computational Journalism Lab (CJL) and their newsletter, Generative AI in the Newsroom. https://generative-ai-newsroom.com/ https://www.linkedin.com/in/nicholas-diakopoulos-83848114/
- Ethan Mollick. Excellent at translating generative AI into practical newsroom and storytelling workflows. https://www.linkedin.com/in/emollick
- Charlie Beckett. Director at LSE's Polis; writes clearly about AI, power, trust, and journalism ethics. https://www.linkedin.com/in/charlie-beckett-2743234/
- Rasmus Kleis Nielsen. Focuses on how audiences, platforms, and AI reshape journalism economics and trust. https://www.linkedin.com/in/rasmus-kleis-nielsen-5b97663/
- Bettina Peters. Strong on newsroom AI adoption, governance, and real-world constraints. https://www.linkedin.com/in/bettina-peters-06a80b5/
- Simon Rogers. Deep experience in data-driven storytelling and automation at scale. https://www.linkedin.com/in/simonrogersjournalist/
- Meredith Broussard. Essential counterweight to hype; strong on why AI often fails journalists and communities. https://www.linkedin.com/in/meredithbroussard/
- Anya Schiffrin. Focuses on media sustainability, regulation, and AI's political consequences. https://www.linkedin.com/in/anya-schiffrin-1459097/
- Chris Moran. One of the best public thinkers inside a major broadcaster on AI experimentation. https://www.linkedin.com/in/chris-moran-6634a87/
- Emily Bell. Columbia Journalism School; essential reading on platforms, AI, and media power. https://www.linkedin.com/in/emily-bell-7091663/
